name: G√©n√©rer des CV ATS sp√©cifiques √† un emploi avec Perplexity AI et exportation PDF
description:
*Ce flux de travail contient des n≈ìuds communautaires qui ne sont compatibles qu'avec la version auto-h√©berg√©e de n8n.*

# Explication du flux de travail de cr√©ation de CV ATS

## Objectif
L'**objectif** du flux de travail *Cr√©ateur de CV ATS selon JD* est d'automatiser la cr√©ation d'un **CV compatible ATS** en adaptant le CV d'un candidat √† une description de poste sp√©cifique (JD). Il rationalise le processus d'alignement du contenu du CV avec les exigences du JD, produisant un CV PDF professionnel et scannable qui peut √™tre stock√© dans Google Drive.

## But
Le **but** est de :
- Permettre aux utilisateurs de saisir leur CV (texte ou PDF) et un JD (PDF) via un formulaire web.
- Extraire et fusionner le texte des deux entr√©es.
- Utiliser l'IA pour personnaliser le CV, en priorisant les mots-cl√©s du JD tout en maintenant les informations v√©ridiques du candidat.
- G√©n√©rer un CV HTML propre et optimis√© pour les ATS et le convertir en PDF t√©l√©chargeable.
- T√©l√©charger le PDF final sur Google Drive pour un acc√®s facile.

Cela garantit que le CV est optimis√© pour les **syst√®mes de suivi des candidatures (ATS)**, qui sont utilis√©s par les employeurs pour filtrer les CV, en incorporant des mots-cl√©s pertinents et en maintenant un format simple et scannable.

## Exigences
Le flux de travail repose sur des composants et des configurations sp√©cifiques :
- **Plateforme n8n** : L'outil d'automatisation h√©bergeant le flux de travail.
- **Exigences des n≈ìuds** :
  1. **D√©clencheur de formulaire** : Un formulaire web pour collecter les entr√©es des utilisateurs (CV texte/PDF, JD PDF).
  2. **Traiter un fichier binaire1** : JavaScript pour renommer et organiser les entr√©es PDF.
  3. **Extraction de CV1** : Extrait le texte des fichiers PDF.
  4. **Fusionner CV + JD1** : Combine le texte du CV et du JD en une seule cha√Æne.
  5. **Personnaliser le CV1** : Utilise Perplexity AI pour g√©n√©rer un CV HTML compatible ATS.
  6. **Format HTML1** : Nettoie la sortie HTML en supprimant les sauts de ligne.
  7. **HTML3** : Traite le HTML pour un affichage ou une validation potentiels.
  8. **HTML en PDF** : Convertit le CV HTML en un fichier PDF.
  9. **T√©l√©charger le fichier** : Enregistre le PDF dans un dossier Google Drive sp√©cifi√©.
- **Identifiants** :
  - *Compte CustomJS* pour l'API de conversion HTML en PDF.
  - *Compte Google Drive* pour les t√©l√©chargements de fichiers.
  - *Compte Perplexity* pour la personnalisation de CV pilot√©e par l'IA.
- **Exigences d'entr√©e** :
  - CV (texte brut ou PDF).
  - Description de poste (PDF).
- **Sortie** : Un CV personnalis√©, compatible ATS au format PDF, t√©l√©charg√© sur Google Drive.

## Utilisation de l'API
Le flux de travail int√®gre plusieurs API pour atteindre sa fonctionnalit√© :
- **API Perplexity** : Utilis√©e dans le n≈ìud *Personnaliser le CV1* pour tirer parti du mod√®le *sonar-reasoning* pour g√©n√©rer un CV HTML optimis√© pour les ATS. L'API traite le texte fusionn√© du CV et du JD, alignant le contenu avec les mots-cl√©s du JD tout en respectant des directives strictes en mati√®re de HTML et CSS (par exemple, police Arial, pas de couleurs, mise en page √† une colonne). [Ref : Workflow JSON]
- **API CustomJS** : Utilis√©e dans le n≈ìud *HTML en PDF* pour convertir le CV HTML nettoy√© en un fichier PDF. Cette API garantit que le CV est transform√© en un format t√©l√©chargeable adapt√© aux syst√®mes ATS. [Ref : Workflow JSON]
- **API Google Drive** : Utilis√©e dans le n≈ìud *T√©l√©charger le fichier* pour stocker le PDF final dans un dossier Google Drive d√©sign√© (*Dossier CV* dans *Mon Drive*). Cette API g√®re les t√©l√©chargements de fichiers s√©curis√©s en utilisant l'authentification OAuth2. [Ref : Workflow JSON]

Ces API sont essentielles pour la personnalisation pilot√©e par l'IA, la g√©n√©ration de PDF et le stockage cloud, garantissant un processus de bout en bout sans faille.

## Conversion HTML en PDF
La conversion HTML en PDF est une √©tape cl√© du flux de travail, g√©r√©e par le n≈ìud **HTML en PDF** :
- **Processus** : Le n≈ìud prend le CV HTML nettoy√© (`$json.cleanedResponse`) du n≈ìud *Format HTML1* et utilise le n≈ìud `@custom-js/n8n-nodes-pdf-toolkit.html2Pdf` pour le convertir en PDF.
- **API** : S'appuie sur l'API *CustomJS* pour une conversion de haute fid√©lit√©, garantissant que le PDF conserve la structure compatible ATS (par exemple, pas de graphiques, hi√©rarchie de texte claire).
- **Sortie** : Un fichier PDF binaire transmis au n≈ìud *T√©l√©charger le fichier*.
- **Pertinence** : Cette √©tape garantit que le CV est dans un format largement accessible, adapt√© au t√©l√©chargement ou au partage avec les employeurs. L'utilisation d'une API d√©di√©e s'aligne sur les pratiques de l'industrie pour la conversion HTML en PDF, comme on le voit dans des services tels que PDFmyURL ou PDFCrowd, qui offrent des capacit√©s similaires d'API REST pour convertir HTML en PDF avec des mises en page personnalisables. [Ref:,][](https://pdfmyurl.com/)[](https://pdfcrowd.com/api/html-to-pdf-api/)

## T√©l√©chargement depuis le lien communautaire
Le flux de travail n'inclut pas explicitement un lien communautaire pour t√©l√©charger le PDF final, mais le n≈ìud **T√©l√©charger le fichier** stocke le PDF dans Google Drive, le rendant accessible via un dossier partag√© ou un lien. Pour permettre des t√©l√©chargements directs :

## R√©sum√© du flux de travail
Le flux de travail *Cr√©ateur de CV ATS selon JD* automatise la cr√©ation d'un CV personnalis√©, compatible ATS en :
1. Collectant les entr√©es des utilisateurs via un formulaire web (*D√©clencheur de formulaire*).
2. Traitant et extrayant le texte des PDF (*Traiter un fichier binaire1*, *Extraction de CV1*).
3. Fusionnant et personnalisant le contenu √† l'aide de *Perplexity AI* (*Fusionner CV + JD1*, *Personnaliser le CV1*).
4. Formatant et convertissant le CV en PDF (*Format HTML1*, *HTML3*, *HTML en PDF*).
5. T√©l√©chargeant le PDF sur Google Drive (*T√©l√©charger le fichier*).

Le flux de travail exploite des API pour le traitement par IA, la conversion PDF et le stockage cloud, garantissant une sortie professionnelle optimis√©e pour les syst√®mes ATS. Le partage communautaire peut √™tre activ√© via des liens Google Drive ou des plateformes externes, comme discut√© dans des ressources web connexes. [Ref:,,][](https://pdfmyurl.com/)[](https://www.servicenow.com/community/servicenow-ai-platform-forum/allow-user-to-download-a-pdf-file-on-click-of-a-button/td-p/1082457)

workflow.name: ATS resume maker accoding to JD

message.content:
=System (paste exactly as-is):

You are a professional resume writer. Build a single, ATS-friendly resume by combining and aligning the candidate‚Äôs resume with the job description contained in:
{{ $json.merged }}

Rules for content:

Tailor the resume to the JD while staying truthful to the candidate‚Äôs information. Prioritize skills/keywords the JD demands. Rephrase; do not invent facts.

Omit sections that have no data instead of adding placeholders.

Prefer the candidate‚Äôs details when resume and JD conflict; only adjust wording to match JD terminology.

Rules for layout & style:

Output one valid HTML document only (no Markdown, no code fences, no JSON, no citations, no comments, no <think> or similar tags, no text before or after).

Use inline CSS inside <style> in the <head>; no external assets (fonts, scripts, images, icons, tables).

Plain white background, black text, font: Arial, sans-serif.

Page-friendly margins (32‚Äì40px), single-column layout, consistent spacing.

Name at top center, bold, ~26‚Äì30px. Contact line centered beneath, smaller.

Section titles (Summary, Skills, Experience, Projects, Education, Certifications, Links) left-aligned, bold, ~18‚Äì20px, with clear top margin.

Use <ul><li> bullet points for skills and achievements. In Experience/Projects, show role/company/location/dates, then concise accomplishment bullets (use metrics where present).

Keep it clean and ATS-safe: no colors, graphics, or fancy layouts.

Output requirement (critical):
Return only:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>‚Ä¶full document with inline <style>‚Ä¶</html>

=Final User Prompt (Strict Version):

You are a professional resume writer.
Your task is to generate a single ATS-friendly resume in plain HTML and CSS only.

Input data (resume + job description) is provided here:
{{ $json.merged }}

Mandatory Guidelines (must follow exactly):

Output only valid HTML and CSS wrapped inside <html>...</html>. No explanations, comments, or extra text outside the HTML.

The resume must be clean, minimal, and professional:

White background, black text, single font (Arial, sans-serif).

Candidate‚Äôs full name: top center, bold, font size 26‚Äì30px.

Contact information: below name, centered, smaller font.

Section titles (Skills, Certifications, Projects, Experience, Education, etc.): bold, left-aligned, font size 18‚Äì20px.

Use bullet points for lists (skills, certifications, responsibilities, achievements).

Maintain consistent spacing (margin-top for sections, padding inside lists).

No colors, tables, or unnecessary design elements.

Resume must combine the resume and job description into a single tailored version that best fits the target role.

The output must be ATS-optimized (clean structure, clear hierarchy, no hidden elements).

Do not include placeholders like <think>, comments, or explanations. Only deliver the final HTML + CSS resume.

parameters.content:
## Form Trigger Node Summary

The **Form Trigger** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow initiates the process by providing a web form for users to submit their resume (text or PDF) and a job description (JD) PDF.

- **Purpose**: Collects user inputs to start the resume tailoring process.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Creates a form at the path *resume-builder* with the title *resume builder*.
  - Captures:
    1. Optional plain text resume input.
    2. Required resume PDF upload (accepts *.pdf* only).
    3. Required JD PDF upload (accepts *.pdf* only).
  - Uses *lastNode* response mode to wait for the workflow to complete.
- **Output**: Sends text and binary (PDF) data to the next node (*Process one binary file1*).
- **Role**: Acts as the workflow‚Äôs entry point, enabling user interaction.

*Note*: This node is critical for gathering the raw data needed to generate an ATS-friendly resume. For more on n8n nodes, see [n8n Docs](https://.docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/).

## Extracting resume1 Node Summary

The **Extracting resume1** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow extracts text from the binary PDF files (resume and JD) processed by the *Process one binary file1* node.

- **Purpose**: Converts PDF files into readable text for further processing.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Uses the *pdf* operation to extract text from the binary data.
  - Dynamically selects the binary file using the expression `={{ Object.keys($binary)[0] }}` to target the first available binary key.
- **Output**: Text extracted from the PDFs, passed to the *Merge Resume + JD1* node.
- **Role**: Enables the workflow to access the content of the resume and JD for tailoring.

*Note*: This node is crucial for transforming PDF inputs into text that can be merged and customized. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

## Process one binary file1 Node Summary

The **Process one binary file1** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow processes the binary data (PDF files) submitted through the *Form Trigger* node.

- **Purpose**: Organizes and renames binary files (resume and JD PDFs) for further processing.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Uses JavaScript to iterate through input items and identify binary data (PDFs).
  - Replaces spaces in binary file keys with *Upload_Resume_PDF* for consistent naming.
  - Outputs:
    1. JSON with the modified *fileName*.
    2. Binary data mapped to the new key (e.g., *Upload_Resume_PDF*).
- **Output**: Structured binary data passed to the *Extracting resume1* node for text extraction.
- **Role**: Ensures clean, standardized file naming for downstream nodes.

*Note*: This node prepares user-uploaded PDFs for text extraction, maintaining workflow efficiency. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

## Merge Resume + JD1 Node Summary

The **Merge Resume + JD1** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow combines the extracted text from the candidate‚Äôs resume and the job description (JD) into a single text string.

- **Purpose**: Merges resume and JD text to prepare for tailored resume generation.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Uses JavaScript to concatenate the resume text (`$json.text`) and JD text (`$item(1).$json["text"]`) with a space separator.
  - Outputs a single JSON object with a *merged* field containing the combined text.
- **Output**: A unified text string passed to the *Customize resume1* node for further processing.
- **Role**: Ensures both resume and JD content are combined for ATS-friendly customization.

*Note*: This node sets the stage for tailoring the resume by providing a single text input. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

*Timestamp*: 02:37 PM IST, Wednesday, August 20, 2025

## AI Perplexity Node Summary

The **Customize resume1** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow uses the *Perplexity AI* model to generate an ATS-friendly resume by tailoring the merged resume and job description (JD) text into a structured HTML format.

- **Purpose**: Leverages *Perplexity AI* to create a customized, ATS-optimized resume based on the merged input.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Employs the *sonar-reasoning* model to process the combined text (`$json.merged`) from the previous node.
  - *Perplexity AI* follows strict instructions to:
    - Produce valid HTML with inline CSS (Arial, sans-serif, black text, white background).
    - Structure the resume with the candidate‚Äôs name (bold, 26‚Äì30px, centered), contact info, and sections like Skills, Experience, and Education using bullet points.
    - Prioritize JD keywords while rephrasing truthfully, avoiding invented facts.
    - Ensure ATS compatibility by using a clean, single-column layout without colors or graphics.
- **Output**: HTML resume content passed to the *HTML format1* node for further processing.
- **Role**: Relies on *Perplexity AI* to intelligently align the resume with the JD, ensuring relevance and scannability.

*Note*: The *Perplexity AI* model is central to tailoring the resume, making it both professional and ATS-friendly. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

## HTML format1 Node Summary

The **HTML format1** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow processes the HTML resume generated by the *Customize resume1* node to ensure it is clean and properly formatted.

- **Purpose**: Cleans and formats the HTML output from the Perplexity AI model for downstream use.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Uses JavaScript to extract the content between `<html>` and `</html>` tags from the AI‚Äôs response (`$json.message`, `$json.content`, or `$json.text`).
  - Removes all newline characters (`\n`) from the HTML to create a compact, single-line string.
  - Outputs a JSON object with:
    - *cleanedResponse*: The cleaned HTML content.
    - *originalResponse*: The original AI response.
    - *error*: A message if no HTML tags are found.
- **Output**: Cleaned HTML passed to the *HTML3* and *HTML to PDF* nodes for further processing.
- **Role**: Ensures the HTML resume is properly formatted and free of unwanted characters for conversion to PDF.

*Note*: This node refines the AI-generated HTML for consistency and compatibility with subsequent nodes. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

*Timestamp*: 02:42 PM IST, Wednesday, August 20, 2025

## Generate HTML Preview Node Summary

The **HTML3** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow processes the cleaned HTML resume output from the *HTML format1* node for further handling or validation.

- **Purpose**: Handles the formatted HTML resume to prepare it for potential display or additional processing.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Receives the cleaned HTML content (`$json.cleanedResponse`) from the *HTML format1* node.
  - Uses the `n8n-nodes-base.html` node (version 1.2) to process the HTML, likely for rendering, validation, or storage purposes.
- **Output**: The processed HTML, which may be used for visualization or debugging (specific output depends on workflow context).
- **Role**: Acts as a processing step for the HTML resume, ensuring it‚Äôs ready for any additional use cases, such as display or logging.

*Note*: This node ensures the HTML resume is properly handled before final output or conversion. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

## HTML to PDF Node Summary

The **HTML to PDF** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow converts the cleaned HTML resume from the *HTML format1* node into a PDF file.

- **Purpose**: Generates a PDF version of the tailored, ATS-friendly resume.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Uses the `@custom-js/n8n-nodes-pdf-toolkit.html2Pdf` node (version 1) to convert the HTML content (`$json.cleanedResponse`) into a PDF.
  - Relies on credentials for a *CustomJS account* to access the PDF conversion service.
- **Output**: A binary PDF file passed to the *Upload file* node for storage.
- **Role**: Transforms the HTML resume into a downloadable PDF format, completing the resume creation process.

*Note*: This node finalizes the resume as a PDF, making it ready for user download or storage. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.

## Upload file Node Summary

The **Upload file** node in the *ATS Resume Maker according to JD* workflow uploads the generated PDF resume to Google Drive.

- **Purpose**: Stores the ATS-friendly resume PDF in a specified Google Drive folder.
- **Key Functions**:
  - Uses the `n8n-nodes-base.googleDrive` node (version 3) to upload the PDF file.
  - Configured to save the file as *NEW_RESUNME* in the *Resume* folder (`1vzNpRjBe1ylcLmJ2TKl4TN40BAeri-HD`) on *My Drive*.
  - Authenticates using a *Google Drive account* credential.
- **Output**: Confirmation of the file upload to Google Drive, completing the workflow.
- **Role**: Ensures the final resume PDF is saved to the user‚Äôs Google Drive for easy access.

*Note*: This node finalizes the workflow by storing the tailored resume PDF in a designated cloud location. See [n8n Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/components/) for more on n8n nodes.
